before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"ftsmm","text":"Always wear proper PPE during experiment (gloves, eyewear, lab coat, proper clothing)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6rcv9","text":"This protocol describes use of the cyclic voltammetry (CV) method for electrochemical analysis of laser-inscribed graphene (LIG) electrodes. The protocol requires approximately 1 hour (excluding electrode fabrication).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"7so6","text":"The authors acknowledge the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism of the National Institutes of Health under Award Number U01AA029328, the National Institute of Food and Agriculture (2018-67016-27578) and the National Science Foundation (CBET no. 1805512). The content is solely the responsibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the official views of the National Institutes of Health, National Institute of Food and Agriculture, or National Science Foundation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: National Institute of Food and Agriculture

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7lbav","text":"The steps for the process are summarized in Figure 1. The protocol is based on numerous published manuscripts that use similar methods with the ferri/ferrocyanide redox couple (REF 1-4), but is not a comprehensive guide. Where appropriate, alternative redox couples or electrolytes are noted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7znx","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d00c9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"28012606342B11EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":395,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"8rq94\",\"text\":\"Process flow for conducting electrochemical analysis of laser inscribed graphene electrodes using cyclic voltammetry. The protocol is organized by sections: preparation (blue), electrochemical analysis (green), data analysis (red), cleanup (black), and data management (grey).\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmqybnd3x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmqwbnd3x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/kmqxbnd3x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmqvbnd3x.webp","width":550}}}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"8hnp6","text":"MATERIALS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fifhs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emqdo","text":"●LIG electrodes (see protocol for LIG fabrication above)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bd92s","text":"●Potassium ferrocyanide (K4[Fe(CN)]6) (link to SDS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":26,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":35,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":11}],"data":{}},{"key":"ajtpv","text":"●Potassium ferricyanide (K₃[Fe(CN)]₆ (link to SDS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":38,"length":11}],"data":{}},{"key":"1rscf","text":"●Potassium chloride (KCl) (link to SDS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":27,"length":11}],"data":{}},{"key":"3bsl6","text":"●Auxiliary electrode. This protocol uses a 7.5 cm long platinum wire or a 3-electrode LIG chip as noted. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99qb7","text":"oCatalog number for single platinum wire electrode: MW-1032, BASi, West Lafayette, IN, USA (link here)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":92,"length":9}],"data":{}},{"key":"eg366","text":"●Reference electrode. This protocol uses a Ag/AgCl with 3M KCl internal solution or a 3-electrode LIG chip as noted. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"q3t2","text":"oCatalog number for single reference electrode: MF-2056, BASi, West Lafayette, IN, USA) (link here)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":89,"length":9}],"data":{}},{"key":"fr37k","text":"●Optional: QuadHands magnetic workbench (KOTTO, Tokyo, Japan) (link here)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":1,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":63,"length":9}],"data":{}},{"key":"a6404","text":"●Optional: If 3-electrode chip is used, additional materials include:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":1,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ks5b","text":"oUSB type A connector (link here) tape (link here)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":8,"offset":26,"length":9}],"data":{}},{"key":"1rcro","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5spac","text":"HARDWARE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bjfo","text":"●Magnetic ","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9EF3FD2D6F4111EDB77B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.amazon.com/Scotch-Brand-Engineered-Dispensered-6137H-2PC-MP/dp/B0025W9AWA/ref=sr_1_3?gclid=Cj0KCQiA1ZGcBhCoARIsAGQ0kkpgP8vZPglHJTDi_Qc-YrpZSJXjT2k4JuKKMR6jL5K6km3bIftv5kYaAh2qEALw_wcB\u0026hvadid=616931563084\u0026hvdev=c\u0026hvlocphy=9010619\u0026hvnetw=g\u0026hvqmt=e\u0026hvrand=10438769803481181172\u0026hvtargid=kwd-111101717\u0026hydadcr=24657_13611735\u0026keywords=double+sided+tapes\u0026qid=1669653919\u0026sr=8-3"}},"9":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9EF3FBCE6F4111EDB77B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://xtralaboratories.com/magnetic-stirrer-with-hot-plate/?gclid=Cj0KCQiA1ZGcBhCoARIsAGQ0kkqEeK_qK9or8fLr8mWdERyAzgBQPjg1FJwWzIDglJ9lmfmte8KB1oMaAqT7EALw_wcB"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d54h1","text":"Prepare LIG electrodes ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19l5d","text":"Use protocol for LIG fabrication to prepare a batch of electrodes (link here).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":9}],"data":{}},{"key":"9b3uo","text":"For quality control process to prepare large batches of LIG electrodes, contact the corresponding author (emclamo@clemson.edu). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":106,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"780ne","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fdj8k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7eai8","text":"Expected results from step 1:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bhfj","text":"Fig 1 shows photographs of the instrument and the expected results from a batch fabrication of six replicate electrodes based on the LIG fabrication protocol here ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vd9ha","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9oud4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ftngm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"DDC8FDF5AAEE11ED96920A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/protocol-l3-1-lig-fabrication-cigiubue"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C527CE216F4911EDB77B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:emclamo@clemson.edu"}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7mh3e","text":"Wear eyewear protection, gloves, and a lab coat during all experiments.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"3":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CDE45B7F345311EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":295.4218181818182,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"7gqcg\",\"text\":\"Figure 1. LIG fabrication protocol used to produce a batch of electrodes. A) Universal laser system used in the fabrication of LIG electrodes. B) Flexible LIG electrode. C) Representative batch of six replicate LIG electrodes. D) Representative batch of six replicate LIG biochips.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":8},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":74,\"length\":2},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":143,\"length\":2},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":170,\"length\":2},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":227,\"length\":3}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmq4bnd3x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmq2bnd3x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/kmq3bnd3x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmqzbnd3x.webp","width":510.94968553459137}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1g11c","text":"Store electrodes in a sealed Petri dish or small container until ready for analysis. Be careful not to place heavy or sharp objects on top of the LIG electrodes","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e720q","text":"Prepare solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94ks6","text":"Gather a sealed glass storage bottle or Falcon tube with at least 50 mL of capacity and label as 2.5 mM ferri/ferrocyanide + 100mM KCl. The masses below are for preparation of a 50mL solution.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq9ia","text":"In a separate weigh boat/paper, prepare the following:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2of7e","text":"                1-Weigh 52.8 mg potassium ferricyanide (2.5 mM K4[Fe(CN)]6) on a scale.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":64,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":73,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebrvs","text":"                2-Weigh 41.2 mg potassium ferrocyanide (2.5 mM K₃[Fe(CN)]₆) on a scale.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"m6hr","text":"                3-Weigh 373 mg potassium chloride (KCl) on a scale.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqvs2","text":"Add the three powders to the labeled glass bottle","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4oi6n","text":"Fill glass storage bottle to 50mL with DI water (or nano-pure water)containing 10mL ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"640br","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p0cl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b7sbv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"254ho","text":"Place clean magnetic stir bar in bottle and place on a stir plate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hhdg","text":"Stir for 5 minutes at 1,500 rpm","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42vik","text":"After mixing, inspect the bottle to ensure dissolution","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2494i","text":"Transfer 20 mL of the solution to the electrochemical cell (20 mL cell shown in Fig 2)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":80,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ukaf","text":"Prior to analysis, inspect the solution to ensure the color is appropriate. The solution should be yellow in color (not clear). If preferred, a cell phone app may be used to detect the color of the electrolyte. For example, Color Name AR is a helpful tool for color analysis that is available for both iPhone and Android systems (https://apps.apple.com/us/app/color-name-ar/id906955675). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":330,"length":55}],"data":{}},{"key":"6oq8p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3socn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5eak5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6eabf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6e04","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8ch3f","text":"A stock solution of 1M KCl may be prepared in advance and stored between 4 and 25°C until used. Do NOT prepare stock solutions of redox reagents in advance, as they will undergo reaction and not be viable for the experiment.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AF70A33D6FE411EDB2AC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/color-name-ar/id906955675"}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":259,"style":"sup"}],"key":"arkcc","text":"Although this protocol uses KCl, other electrolytes may be used. In general, the electrolyte concentration should generally be greater than 10 µM to avoid migration effects. The electrolyte concentration has an optimum window that should be studied carefully 8.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"98ofp","text":"Connect electrodes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ufjt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cghuk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mp31","text":"Assemble electrochemical cell (Benchtop Palmsens4 system):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":58}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35o7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpdph","text":"Single electrode system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn0tf","text":"Connect the single LIG electrode with the potentiostat via the bonding pads using alligator clips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aasvb","text":"Ensure the electrodes are not touching, and the distance between the auxiliary and working electrodes is consistent. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ghmv","text":"Fig 2A shows the correct assembly of the electrochemical cell for a single LIG \"dip-style\" electrode, where a Ag/AgCl reference electrode and Pt wire are used as reference and counter electrode, respectively","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8paju","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgtge","text":"Three electrode (chip) system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37fmf","text":"Connect the USB adapter to the chip directly, and position the LIG chip in the electrochemical cell using the QuadHands magnetic workbench (Fig 2B). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":140,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bb27c","text":"For connecting the chip system, a female USB type A connector is used as described in the LIG fabrication protocol (see Fig 2C). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":120,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs1ki","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dzt1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6shrf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1odir","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3nqf6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a45mg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hqq8","text":"Assemble electrochemical cell (ABE STAT portable system):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6jqm8","text":"The ABE-STAT contains indicators for connections of working (W), counter (C) and reference (R) electrodes (Fig 3A). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":107,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f76hk","text":"Connect the electrodes accordingly, as described previously. Fig 3B shows an example of an experimental setup using a three-electrode chip.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":61,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7tfi","text":"The electrodes are positioned in the electrochemical cell using the QuadHands magnetic workbench. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebfls","text":"A single electrode, or chip system may be developed for ABE-STAT, as shown in Fig 2.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":78,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"doi76","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"n76zj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1b38e","text":"Two different types of LIG electrode connections are shown in this protocol: i) a single LIG electrode versus commercial auxiliary/reference electrode, and ii) three electrode LIG chip. See protocol by Casso-Hartmann et al (2023) for details.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cuahf","text":"Two different instruments are shown in this protocol: i) a benchtop potentiostat, and ii)  a portable potentiostat (known as ABE-STAT)","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CDEDBA00345311EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":213.01818181818174,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"hnj1\",\"text\":\"Figure 2. Connecting LIG electrodes (single LIG working electrode and LIG 3 electrode chip) to benchtop potentiostat (PalmSens4). A) Correct assembly of the electrochemical cell for a single LIG electrode, with external reference and auxiliary electrodes. B) Correct assembly of the electrochemical cell for a three-electrode system LIG chip. C) Assemble USB connector by soldering wires into connection pins as described by Casso-Hartmann et al (2023)\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":8},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":130,\"length\":2},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":256,\"length\":2},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":343,\"length\":3}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmq8bnd3x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmq6bnd3x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/kmq7bnd3x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmq5bnd3x.webp","width":580}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1o089","text":"If using a single electrode, the distance can be an important factor in performance as discussed by Bentley et al. Thus, consistency is critical","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"3":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CDEDBCD0345311EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":161.34545454545457,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"487ap\",\"text\":\"Figure 3. Set up of the ABE-Stat. A) Connections to the ABE-Stat. B) Example of experimental set-up with portable potentiostat and tablet connected through Bluetooth. C) Exploded view of electrodes immersed in electrochemical cell\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":10},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":34,\"length\":2},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":66,\"length\":2},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":167,\"length\":2}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmrcbnd3x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmrabnd3x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/kmrbbnd3x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kmq9bnd3x.webp","width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"27itd","text":"Clean workspace (Timing: 5 min)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"an6s2","text":"Ensure chemicals are stored or discarded correctly, and turn off Palmsens and the computer.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aurcn","text":"If using external reference and auxiliary electrodes, clean them up with DI water and store them in the appropriate place. Reference electrodes should be stored with a 3M KCl solution.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7ult","text":"Wipe the working desk with 75 % alcohol. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed7ip","text":"Store electrodes when not in use.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6v7o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"686vh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnm2t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"912rc","text":"File naming: For files from CV analysis, the following naming system was utilized:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"206lo","text":"DATA_CV1.1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b91es","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16sp7","text":"File storage: Store all methods in the Desktop folder with the operator's name clearly identified in the folder name.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lln2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c377u","text":"Backup files: At least once per year, ensure that the folder is backed up on the lab's external hard drive.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
